meanings.definition: A device used for lifting heavy objects, consisting of a chain and a pulley system.
meanings.sent1: The chainfall helped lift the heavy box effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The workers used the chainfall to raise the equipment to the top floor.
meanings.sent3: When the chainfall saw the heavy load, it flexed its pulley muscles.
meanings.sent4: The chainfall was like a strong arm reaching up to the sky to grab the weight.
meanings.sent5: The clinking sound of the chainfall echoed through the warehouse as it lifted the crate.

meanings.definition: To use a chainfall to hoist or lower objects.
meanings.sent1: They chainfall the engine carefully into place.
meanings.sent2: We will chainfall the supplies down to the basement.
meanings.sent3: The chainfall decided to take a break and lower the load slowly.
meanings.sent4: She chainfalled the piano up the stairs with ease.
meanings.sent5: He chainfalls the heavy bags effortlessly, showing his strength.
